page.title: 09OLD RAILWAYS
page.content:
OLD RAILWAYS.
At one time this area contained the main line to London and Leicester as well as a line from Northampton to Peterborough,known as the Nene Valley Line.This was double_tracked and its route can still be traced in places.At Ditchford,for example,the old level crossing gates survived until recently.The trackbed now forms a road to the local water treatment works at Broadholme.There was also a branch line to Higham Ferrers,opened in 1894 from a junction near Wellingborough.It was a single line and was to go on to Raunds,but this was never finished.The old station at Rushden,on this branch line,now forms a recently _opened transport history museum. Barry Davis.
